description.short: Misura la vulnerabilitÃ  derivante dalla focalizzazione attentiva ristretta che esclude informazioni periferiche importanti durante le indagini di sicurezza
description.context: Il tunneling cognitivo si verifica quando i professionisti della sicurezza diventano cosÃ¬ focalizzati su un aspetto specifico di un incidente o indagine che inconsciamente escludono indicatori periferici importanti. Questo stato cognitivo ristretto crea vulnerabilitÃ  sistematiche dove gli analisti "mancano la foresta per gli alberi", concentrandosi intensamente su un singolo indicatore di compromissione mentre perdono attivitÃ  di attacco correlate. Il tunneling cognitivo Ã¨ particolarmente pericoloso durante le indagini ad alta pressione dove il focus intenso sembra produttivo ma crea effettivamente punti ciechi.
description.impact: Le organizzazioni che sperimentano tunneling cognitivo mancano attacchi laterali mentre si focalizzano su un vettore iniziale, trascurano escalation di privilegi mentre investigano esfiltrazione di dati, e perdono attivitÃ  di persistence mentre remediano malware iniziale. Gli incidenti storici mostrano che il tunneling cognitivo contribuisce a tassi elevati di reinfezione e rilevamento incompleto dell'ambito della violazione. Gli attaccanti sofisticati sfruttano il tunneling cognitivo creando indicatori "rumorosi" che catturano l'attenzione mentre conducono obiettivi primari attraverso canali piÃ¹ silenziosi.
description.psychological_basis: La ricerca di Wickens e Alexander (2009) sull'attenzione cognitiva mostra come lo stress e l'alto carico di lavoro inducano tunneling attentivo, dove il campo percettivo si restringe. Gli studi di Dirkin e Hancock (1985) dimostrano che sotto stress, le persone si focalizzano sempre piÃ¹ su indicatori centrali mentre perdono informazioni periferiche. La ricerca neuroscientifica mostra che l'alta attivazione dell'amigdala (risposta allo stress) riduce il campo attentivo mediato dalla corteccia prefrontale. La Teoria del Carico Cognitivo di Kahneman dimostra che risorse attentive limitate sotto pressione portano a strategie di campionamento selettivo che possono perdere minacce critiche.

sections.title: QUICK ASSESSMENT

items.title: Monitoraggio Continuato Durante Incidenti ad Alta PrioritÃ
items.question: Quando il vostro team di sicurezza sta rispondendo a un incidente ad alta prioritÃ  (come una potenziale violazione o interruzione del sistema), quale processo assicura che continuino a monitorare altre minacce?

options.label: Processo documentato con protocolli di rotazione, team di monitoraggio backup si attiva automaticamente, esempio recente dimostra efficacia
Comprensione informale che qualcuno dovrebbe continuare a monitorare, ma nessuna procedura formale di passaggio consegne o rotazione
Tutto il personale disponibile si concentra sull'incidente primario, altro monitoraggio si ferma durante incidenti maggiori

items.evidence_required: Procedure di risposta agli incidenti, protocolli di rotazione, esempio di incidente recente con monitoraggio continuato

items.title: Tasso di Rilevamento Attacchi Multi-Vettore
items.question: Quanto spesso scoprite che gli attaccanti hanno usato mÃ©todi di attacco mÃºltipli simultanei (come DDoS + esfiltrazione dati, o phishing + movimento laterale) durante un singolo incidente?

options.label: Rilevato frequentemente durante indagine iniziale (>80% degli attacchi multi-vettore identificati come coordinati entro 24 ore)
Talvolta scoperto durante l'indagine (tasso di rilevamento 40-80%), spesso trovato nell'analisi post-incidente
Raramente identificato come attacchi coordinati (tasso di rilevamento <40%), solitamente scoperto settimane dopo o per niente

items.evidence_required: Analisi incidenti che mostra tasso di rilevamento multi-vettore, esempio di attacco coordinato recente

items.title: Processo di Prioritizzazione Overflow Allarmi
items.question: Quando gli allarmi di sicurezza si accumulano e il vostro team non puÃ² investigarli tutti immediatamente, qual Ã¨ la vostra procedura per assicurare che nulla di critico venga perso?

options.label: Triage sistematico con criteri decisionali documentati, monitoraggio in background per allarmi a bassa prioritÃ , trigger di escalation se emergono pattern
Focus sugli allarmi a prioritÃ  massima, allarmi a prioritÃ  inferiore in coda ma potrebbero non essere indagati se arrivano nuovi allarmi ad alta prioritÃ
Approccio best effort, allarmi piÃ¹ vecchi o a prioritÃ  minore spesso respinti o auto-chiusi senza indagine durante periodi ad alto volume

items.evidence_required: Procedure di triage allarmi, esempio di periodo ad alto volume recente, processo di revisione allarmi respinti
items.soc_mapping: TI (tunneling index) calculation based on low-priority alert handling

items.title: Controlli di Sicurezza Durante Urgenza Operativa
items.question: Durante manutenzione IT urgente o risoluzione problemi, quali controlli prevengono che i vostri team tecnici bypassino accidentalmente le procedure di sicurezza?

options.label: Autorizzazione obbligatoria a due persone per qualsiasi bypass di sicurezza, eccezioni a tempo limitato con ripristino automatico, notifica al team di sicurezza richiesta
Approvazione richiesta ma puÃ² essere retroattiva, i controlli di sicurezza possono essere bypassati temporaneamente con documentazione
L'urgenza operativa ha prioritÃ , i team tecnici possono bypassare i controlli di sicurezza come necessario per risolvere problemi rapidamente

items.evidence_required: Politiche di override sicurezza, esempio recente di bypass emergenza con record di approvazione

items.title: Monitoraggio Backup Durante Focus Profondo
items.question: Come assicurate che il monitoraggio della sicurezza continui con piena efficacia quando il vostro team Ã¨ profondamente concentrato su un'indagine complessa di un incidente o sulla risoluzione di problemi tecnici?

options.label: Sistemi automatizzati forniscono monitoraggio backup, sistema buddy abbina focus profondo con consapevolezza ampia, controlli attenzione obbligatori ogni 30 minuti
Qualche monitoraggio automatizzato continua, ma supervisione umana ridotta durante indagini intensive
Il team si focalizza sul problema complesso, efficacia monitoraggio ridotta fino al completamento dell'indagine

items.evidence_required: Procedure di monitoraggio backup, sistemi di allertamento automatizzati, documentazione sistema buddy

items.title: Correlazione Allarmi Cross-Domain
items.question: Quando i vostri strumenti di sicurezza generano allarmi in categorie diverse (rete, endpoint, email, cloud) simultaneamente, quale processo assicura che gli analisti li correlino per rilevare attacchi coordinati?

options.label: Correlazione SIEM automatizzata con dashboard visive che mostrano attivitÃ  cross-domain, revisioni big-picture obbligatorie ogni 15 minuti durante incidenti
Gli analisti revisionano manualmente diversi strumenti di sicurezza, la correlazione avviene se l'analista nota pattern attraverso gli strumenti
Ogni tipo di allarme indagato da team specializzato, correlazione cross-domain avviene raramente

items.evidence_required: Regole di correlazione SIEM, esempi di rilevamento attacchi cross-domain, screenshot dashboard

items.title: Formazione Consapevolezza Situazionale
items.question: Quale formazione ricevono i membri del vostro team di sicurezza per mantenere consapevolezza situazionale durante incidenti ad alto stress?

options.label: Esercizi tabletop trimestrali con scenari multi-vettore simultanei, formazione gestione attenzione, efficacia verificata in incidenti reali
Esiste formazione generale di risposta agli incidenti, ma non affronta specificamente allocazione attenzione o consapevolezza periferica
Nessuna formazione specifica sul mantenimento di consapevolezza ampia durante periodi di focus intenso

items.evidence_required: Curriculum formazione con contenuti su tunneling cognitivo, risultati simulazioni, esempi di incidenti reali
items.soc_mapping: training completion records, simulation performance metrics

items.title: Protocolli Obbligatori Rotazione Attenzione
items.question: Durante operazioni di sicurezza estese (incidenti che durano >2 ore), quali protocolli assicurano che i membri del team resettino periodicamente la loro attenzione e scansionino minacce periferiche?

options.label: Rotazione obbligatoria di 90 minuti tra focus profondo e scansione ambientale, procedure di reset attenzione guidate da checklist
Membri del team incoraggiati a fare pause, ma nessuna procedura formale di rotazione o reset attenzione
Membri del team lavorano continuamente su incidenti fino alla risoluzione, pause prese solo quando necessario

items.evidence_required: Protocolli di rotazione, log incidenti estesi che mostra implementazione rotazione

sections.instructions: Selezionare UNA opzione per ciascuna domanda. Ogni risposta contribuisce al punteggio finale ponderato. Le evidenze dovrebbero essere documentate per la traccia di audit.

items.text: Quanfate il vostro team di sicurezza is rispondonoing to a high-priority incident (like a potential breach or system outage), what elaborano ensures they continue monitoring for other threats? Tell us il vostro specific esempio of how this worked during il vostro last major incident.

scoring_guidance.green: Specific documented process with rotation protocols, backup team activation, recent successful esempio of detecting secondary threat during major incident
scoring_guidance.yellow: Some awareness of need but informal process, inconsistent implementation, no esempio recentes
scoring_guidance.red: All hands focus on primary incident, monitoring pauses, 'we deal with one thing at a time' approach

followups.text: During il vostro last major security incident, did voi discover any secondary attack activity that was happening simultaneously? How long did it take to discover it?
Cosa happens to il vostro routine security monitoring when the entire team is focused on a critical incident?

items.text: Con quale frequenza fate voi discover that attackers used multiple simultaneous attack methods (like DfateS + data exfiltration, or phishing + lateral movement) during a single incident? What percentage of il vostro incidenti di sicurezza involve multiple concurrent attack vectors?

scoring_guidance.green: Specific metrics che mostra >80% detection rate for coordinated attacks, esempios of successful early correlation
scoring_guidance.yellow: Aware that multi-vector attacks occur but no metrics, correlation happens eventually through investigation
scoring_guidance.red: Most attacks treated as single-vector, coordinated nature discovered weeks later or never

followups.text: Quanfate voi fate discover multi-vector attacks, at what point in the investigation fate voi typically realize they're coordinated? Initial detection, during investigation, or post-incident analysis?
fate il vostro security tools automatically flag when multiple attack categories activate within short time winfatews?

items.text: Qual Ã¨ il vostro procedure when alert di sicurezza pile up and il vostro team can't investigate them all immediately? Describe how voi prioritize and ensure nothing critical gets missed. Give us a esempio recente of when this elaborano was tested.

scoring_guidance.green: Documented triage with decision criteria, background monitoring maintains coverage, esempio recente of catching critical alert during high-volume period
scoring_guidance.yellow: Priority-based approach but no formal triage process, low-priority alerts may be dismissed
scoring_guidance.red: Alerts auto-close after aging out, focus only on highest severity, no mechanism to detect patterns in dismissed alerts

followups.text: Have voi ever discovered that something important was hiding in the low-priority alerts that got dismissed during a busy period?
Cosa percentage of il vostro alerts are investigated versus dismissed, and how fate voi revisione dismissed alerts for patterns?

items.text: During urgent IT maintenance or troubleshooting, what controls prevent il vostro technical teams from accidentally bypassing security procedures? Tell us about a recent situation where operational urgency conflicted with security protocols.

scoring_guidance.green: Mandatory controls with two-person authorization, time-limited exceptions, automatic restoration, esempio recente of controlled emergency bypass
scoring_guidance.yellow: Approval required but often retroactive, security bypasses documented but not always prevented
scoring_guidance.red: Operations can bypass security as needed for urgent issues, 'fix first, document later' culture

followups.text: Quanfate was l'ultima volta a technical team had to bypass a security control to resolve an urgent issue? What was the approval elaborano?
Come fate voi ensure temporary security bypasses are restored after the emergency is resolved?

items.text: Come fate voi ensure security monitoring continues at full effectiveness when il vostro team is deeply focused on complex incident investigation or technical problem-solving? What specific backup elaboranoes activate?

scoring_guidance.green: Automated backup monitoring systems, documented buddy system protocols, attention check procedures, esempio recente of backup system detecting threat during complex investigation
scoring_guidance.yellow: Some automated monitoring continues but reduced human oversight, informal awareness of blind spot risk
scoring_guidance.red: Monitoring effectiveness degrades during complex investigations, 'all hands on deck' approach

followups.text: During il vostro most recent complex investigation that took several hours, what was happening with il vostro routine security monitoring?
fate voi use a buddy system where one person maintains deep focus while another maintains broad awareness?

items.text: Quanfate il vostro security tools generate alerts in different categories (network, endpoint, email, etc.) simultaneously, what elaborano ensures analysts correlate them to detect coordinated attacks? Give us an esempio of when voi successfully caught such an attack.

scoring_guidance.green: Automated SIEM correlation with visual cross-domain dashboards, mandatory periodic big-picture revisiones, specific esempio of successful multi-domain correlation
scoring_guidance.yellow: Manual correlation possible if analyst happens to notice, some SIEM rules but incomplete coverage
scoring_guidance.red: Siloed teams investigate their domain separately, correlation rare or accidental

followups.text: Can voi show us il vostro SIEM dashboard that displays activity across all security fatemains simultaneously?
fate specialized teams (network, endpoint, email security) communicate during active investigations to share observations?

items.text: Cosa training fate il vostro team di sicurezza members receive to maintain situational awareness during high-stress incidents? How fate voi verify this training is effective in real situations?

scoring_guidance.green: Quarterly tabletop exercises specifically designed for multi-vector scenarios, cognitive tunneling awareness training, verified effectiveness through real incident analysis
scoring_guidance.yellow: General incident response training exists, mentions importance of awareness but no specific practice
scoring_guidance.red: Training focuses on technical investigation skills, no attention to cognitive factors or situational awareness

followups.text: Have voi conducted any simulations where the team had to gestisce multiple simultaneous security events? What did voi learn?
fate il vostro team members know what cognitive tunneling is and how to recognize when they're experiencing it?

solutions.title: Attention Rotation Protocol
solutions.description: Implement mandatory 90-minute focus rotations where team members switch between deep incident analysis and broad environmental scanning
solutions.implementation: Create checklist-driven handoffs that force attention reset and peripheral awareness check. Deploy monitoring dashboards that alert when any team member exceeds focus time limits without environmental scanning. Document rotation schedule and enforce through team leads.
solutions.technical_controls: Automated attention timers, rotation scheduling system, mandatory big-picture dashboard revisiones

solutions.title: Cross-Domain Alert Correlation System
solutions.description: Deploy SIEM correlation rules that automatically flag when multiple attack vectors activate within specified time windows
solutions.implementation: Create visual dashboards che mostra attack activity across all security domains simultaneously (network, endpoint, email, cloud, identity). Establish mandatory 15-minute 'big picture' revisiones during any incident lasting longer than 2 hours. Configure correlation rules for common multi-vector patterns.
solutions.technical_controls: SIEM correlation engine, unified security dashboard, automated multi-vector alerts

solutions.title: Security Override Controls
solutions.description: Implement two-person authorization for any security control bypass during operational urgencies
solutions.implementation: Create time-limited security exceptions with automatic restoration. Deploy monitoring that alerts security teams when operational procedures create potential vulnerabilities, requiring explicit security team acknowledgment. Document all overrides with business justification.
solutions.technical_controls: PAM integration for override approval, automated exception expiration, security bypass monitoring alerts

solutions.title: Incident Response Buddy System
solutions.description: Pair incident responders where one person maintains deep focus while their partner maintains broad environmental awareness
solutions.implementation: Rotate roles every hour during extended incidents. Create mandatory 'what else could be happening?' checkpoints every 30 minutes during critical incident response. Document buddy assignments in incident response procedures.
solutions.technical_controls: Incident management system with buddy tracking, checkpoint timers, role rotation scheduling

solutions.title: Peripheral Awareness Training
solutions.description: Conduct quarterly tabletop exercises with simultaneous multi-vector attacks designed specifically to test attention allocation
solutions.implementation: Train teams to recognize cognitive tunneling symptoms in themselves and colleagues. Implement 'attention check' protocols where team members regularly verify each other's situational awareness during high-stress periods. Use simulation results to identify individual tunneling patterns.
solutions.technical_controls: Simulation platform for multi-vector scenarios, training completion tracking, competency assessments

solutions.title: Automated Background Monitoring
solutions.description: Deploy AI-powered systems that maintain broad threat detection while human teams focus on specific incidents
solutions.implementation: Create escalation procedures that interrupt deep focus when background systems detect related or coordinated attack activity. Implement 'attention guardian' alerts that notify tunnel-focused analysts of developing threats outside their current scope. Configure behavioral analytics for anomaly detection across all security domains.
solutions.technical_controls: UEBA/AI threat detection, automated escalation system, peripheral threat alerting

solutions.title: Workload Capacity Management
solutions.description: Design security operations to respect cognitive load limitations through task rotation, environmental design, and workload distribution strategies
solutions.implementation: Monitor concurrent task counts and implement maximum limits. Create visual workload indicators for team leads. Establish escalation protocols when cognitive load exceeds capacity thresholds. Implement automated task queuing and load balancing.
solutions.technical_controls: Workload monitoring dashboard, task distribution automation, capacity threshold alerts

solutions.title: Alert Triage Enhancement
solutions.description: Implement systematic triage with documented decision criteria and background monitoring for dismissed alerts
solutions.implementation: Create pattern detection across dismissed low-priority alerts. Establish escalation triggers if dismissed alerts show correlation patterns. Implement weekly revisione of auto-closed alerts for missed threat indicators.
solutions.technical_controls: Automated alert triage system, pattern correlation for dismissed alerts, weekly digest reports

risk_scenarios.title: Multi-Vector Attack During Incident Response
risk_scenarios.description: Attackers launch obvious DDoS attacks to consume security team attention, while simultaneously conducting subtle data exfiltration through compromised email accounts. Security team tunnel-focuses on DDoS mitigation while missing ongoing data theft, resulting in massive data breach.
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Cognitive tunneling causes team to allocate all attention resources to visible DDoS threat while automated exfiltration operates undetected
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Target 2013 - Security teams tunnel-focused on POS malware alerts while missing lateral movement and data exfiltration through network segments

risk_scenarios.title: Lateral Movement During Technical Focus
risk_scenarios.description: While IT teams tunnel on resolving a critical system outage, attackers exploit the distraction to move laterally through network segments using compromised service accounts. Technical teams bypass normal access controls to expedite repairs, inadvertently providing additional attack pathways.
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Exploit operational urgency and reduced security oversight during system outage
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Intense focus on outage resolution creates blind spots for lateral movement, urgency justifies security control bypasses
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Equifax 2017 - IT teams' tunnel focus on urgent patching activities contributed to missing Apache Struts exploitation during high operational focus period

risk_scenarios.title: Supply Chain Compromise During Alert Fatigue
risk_scenarios.description: Security teams become tunnel-focused on high-volume, low-sophistication attacks while attackers embed malicious code in software updates. The focus on obvious threats creates blind spots for sophisticated supply chain attacks that bypass traditional detection methods.
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Software supply chain compromise during period of high alert volume
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Alert fatigue combined with tunneling on high-priority alerts causes team to miss low-and-slow supply chain indicators
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: SolarWinds 2020 - Security teams' tunnel focus on traditional IOCs and known attack patterns missed supply chain compromise operating outside typical attention frameworks

risk_scenarios.title: Insider Threat During External Focus
risk_scenarios.description: While security teams intensely monitor external threats and perimeter defenses, malicious insiders exploit the attention gap to exfiltrate sensitive data through legitimate business applications, avoiding detection by staying outside the externally-focused security monitoring scope.
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Insider abuse of legitimate access during external threat focus
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Organizational tunneling on external threats creates systematic blind spot for insider activities
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Sony Pictures 2014 - Security teams' tunnel focus on protecting specific high-value assets led to insufficient attention to email systems and administrative networks

risk_scenarios.title: Ransomware Deployment During Investigation
risk_scenarios.description: While security team deeply investigates initial compromise and attacker persistence mechanisms, threat actors deploy ransomware across the network. The tunnel focus on forensic investigation delays detection of the ransomware deployment until encryption is widespread.
risk_scenarios.attack_vector: Ransomware deployment during intensive forensic investigation of initial breach
risk_scenarios.psychological_mechanism: Deep focus on understanding attack mechanisms creates temporal blind spot for ongoing attacker activities
risk_scenarios.historical_esempio: Multiple ransomware incidents where investigation of initial breach vector provided cover for ransomware staging and deployment
